text.div:
NHS England APIM Base API Definitions

  • Implementation Guide Version: 0.0.1
  • FHIR Version: 4.0.1
  • Supported Formats: json
  • Supported Patch Formats:
  • Published on: Tue Jan 30 00:00:00 GMT 2024
  • Published by: NHS England

Note to Implementers: FHIR Capabilities

Any FHIR capability may be 'allowed' by the system unless explicitly marked as "SHALL NOT". A few items are marked as MAY in the Implementation Guide to highlight their potential relevance to the use case.

FHIR RESTful Capabilities

Mode: server

Summary of System-wide Interactions

Capabilities by Resource/Profile

Summary

The summary table lists the resources that are part of this configuration, and for each resource it lists:

  • The relevant profiles (if any)
  • The interactions supported by each resource (Read, Search, Update, and Create, are always shown, while VRead, Patch, Delete, History on Instance, or History on Type are only present if at least one of the resources has support for them.
  • The required, recommended, and some optional search parameters (if any).
  • The linked resources enabled for _include
  • The other resources enabled for _revinclude
  • The operations on the resource (if any)
Resource TypeProfileRSUCDSearches_include_revincludeOperations
DocumentReferencehttps://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/DocumentReferenceyyyyysubject:identifier, custodian:identifier, next-page-token, based-on:identifier
Endpointhttps://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/Endpointyyyy_has, Endpoint.identifier
HealthcareServicehttps://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/HealthcareServiceyyyy_id, HealthcareService.providedBy, HealthcareService.identifier
Organizationhttps://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/Organizationyyyy_id, Organization.identifier, identifier, active, type, name, address-country, ods-role, ods-lastChangeDate, ods-activeRole
OrganizationAffiliationhttps://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/OrganizationAffiliationyidentifier, active, primary-organization, participating-organization
Patienthttps://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/Patient
Additional supported profiles:
  PatientPDS		yy_fuzzy-match, _exact-match, _history, _max-results, identifier, family, given, gender, birthdate, death-date, address-postalcode, address-postcode, general-practitioner, email, phone
Practitionerhttps://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/Practitionery_query
PractitionerRolehttps://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/PractitionerRoleypractitioner:identifier
RelatedPersonhttps://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/RelatedPersonyidentifier, patient:identifierRelatedPerson:patient
ServiceRequesthttps://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/ServiceRequestyyidentifier, patient:identifier, ServiceRequest.identifierAppointment:based-on, Task:focus

Resource Conformance: MAYDocumentReference

Base System Profile
https://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/DocumentReference
Profile Conformance
SHALL
Reference Policy

Interaction summary
  • SHOULD support read, create, update, delete, search-type.

Documentation

API present in

  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API
  • National Record Locator - FHIR API v3 as STU3
  • e-Referral Service - FHIR API

No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements

Search Parameters
ConformanceParameterTypeDocumentation
MAYsubject:identifiertoken
  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API
  • National Record Locator - FHIR API v3

International and Care Connect API suggest using patient instead of subject, this would also be consistent with other NHS England API's

MAYcustodian:identifiertoken
  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API
MAYnext-page-tokentoken
  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API
MAYbased-on:identifiertoken
  • This may not be correct and is inferred from A005 e-Referral Service - FHIR API
 

Resource Conformance: MAYEndpoint

Base System Profile
https://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/Endpoint
Profile Conformance
SHALL
Reference Policy

Interaction summary
  • SHOULD support read, delete, update, search-type.

Documentation

API present in

  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API

No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements

Search Parameters
ConformanceParameterTypeDocumentation
MAY_hastoken
  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API
MAYEndpoint.identifiertoken
  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API believe this should be identifier
 

Resource Conformance: MAYHealthcareService

Base System Profile
https://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/HealthcareService
Profile Conformance
SHALL
Reference Policy

Interaction summary
  • SHOULD support search-type.
  • MAY support read, update, delete.

Documentation

API present in

  • e-Referral Service Patient Care
  • e-Referral FHIR API
  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API

No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements

Search Parameters
ConformanceParameterTypeDocumentation
MAY_idstring

e-Referral FHIR API

MAYHealthcareService.providedBytoken
  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API believe this should be organization:identifier
MAYHealthcareService.identifiertoken
  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API believe this should be identifier
 

Resource Conformance: MAYOrganization

Base System Profile
https://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/Organization
Profile Conformance
SHALL
Reference Policy

Interaction summary
  • SHOULD support read, search-type.
  • MAY support update, delete.

Documentation

API present in

  • Organisation Data Service - FHIR API
  • e-Referral Service Patient Care
  • e-Referral FHIR API
  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API

Used by

  • EPS consumers.

No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements

Search Parameters
ConformanceParameterTypeDocumentation
MAY_idstring

e-Referral FHIR API

MAYOrganization.identifiertoken
  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API believe this should be identifier
MAYidentifiertoken
  • Organisation Data Service - FHIR API
MAYactivetoken
  • Organisation Data Service - FHIR API
MAYtypetoken
  • Organisation Data Service - FHIR API
MAYnamestring
  • Organisation Data Service - FHIR API
MAYaddress-countrystring
  • Organisation Data Service - FHIR API
MAYods-roletoken
  • Organisation Data Service - FHIR API EPS expects this data to be type
MAYods-lastChangeDatedate
  • Organisation Data Service - FHIR API FHIR developers would expect this to be _lastUpdated
MAYods-activeRoletoken
  • Organisation Data Service - FHIR API concerned we have two searches on an extension
 

Resource Conformance: MAYOrganizationAffiliation

Base System Profile
https://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/OrganizationAffiliation
Profile Conformance
SHALL
Reference Policy

Interaction summary
  • SHOULD support search-type.

Documentation

API present in

  • Organisation Data Service - FHIR API

No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements

Search Parameters
ConformanceParameterTypeDocumentation
MAYidentifiertoken
  • Organisation Data Service - FHIR API
MAYactivetoken
  • Organisation Data Service - FHIR API
MAYprimary-organizationreference
  • Organisation Data Service - FHIR API
MAYparticipating-organizationreference
  • Organisation Data Service - FHIR API
 

Resource Conformance: MAYPatient

Base System Profile
https://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/Patient
Profile Conformance
SHALL
Reference Policy

Supported Profiles

https://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/PatientPDS

Interaction summary
  • SHOULD support read, search-type.

Documentation

API present in:

  • Personal Demographics Service FHIR API

Used by

  • EPS consumers.

SHOULD and SHALL conformance is taken from UK Core FHIR Access - MAY is used to indicate no conformance (added due to rendering issue in the publisher)

Search Parameters
ConformanceParameterTypeDocumentation
SHALLidentifiertoken

A search by NHS Number. Missing from PDS is a read operation instead - so using transient id instead of identifier

SHALLgivenstring
SHOULDfamilystring
SHOULDgenderstring
SHOULDbirthdatedate
MAY_fuzzy-matchstring

PDS using non standard parameter

MAY_exact-matchstring

PDS is using non standard parameter. Do not believe this is :exact from modifiers although it sounds similar and may cause confusion

MAY_historystring

PDS is using non standard parameter. Do not believe this is _history from history this probably results in confusion for developers

MAY_max-resultsstring

PDS is using non standard parameter. PDS probably should be using _count _count which should be ok as PDS does not support paging

MAYdeath-datedate
MAYaddress-postalcodestring
MAYaddress-postcodestring

PDS is using non standard parameter - will be deprecated in the future

MAYgeneral-practitionerreference

A search by ODS Code. PDS SHOULD be using general-practitioner:identifier with token type to follow NHS Digital FHIR policy. It is workable as it is but this is searching on an id which is transient (changeable), searching on identifier is recommended.

MAYemailtoken
MAYphonetoken
 

Resource Conformance: MAYPractitioner

Base System Profile
https://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/Practitioner
Profile Conformance
SHALL
Reference Policy

Interaction summary
  • SHOULD support search-type.

Documentation

API present in

  • e-Referral FHIR API

No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements

Search Parameters
ConformanceParameterTypeDocumentation
MAY_querystring
  • e-Referral FHIR API
 

Resource Conformance: MAYPractitionerRole

Base System Profile
https://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/PractitionerRole
Profile Conformance
SHALL
Reference Policy

Interaction summary
  • SHOULD support search-type.

Documentation

API present in

  • e-Referral FHIR API (NOT CONFORMANT)

No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements

Search Parameters
ConformanceParameterTypeDocumentation
MAYpractitioner:identifiertoken

e-Referral FHIR API - This parameter is NOT present but is believed to be implied. This API is believed to be NOT CONFORMANT as the api as currently stated should return all PractitionreRole's held by eRS and this is clearly not correct.

 

Resource Conformance: MAYRelatedPerson

Base System Profile
https://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/RelatedPerson
Profile Conformance
SHALL
Reference Policy

Interaction summary
  • SHOULD support search-type.

Documentation

API present in

  • Personal Demographics Service FHIR API
  • Proxy.

No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements)

Search Parameters
ConformanceParameterTypeDocumentation
MAYidentifiertoken

A search by NHS Number. Proxy query parameter and not supported on PDS

MAYpatient:identifiertoken

A search by NHS Number. Proxy uses query parameter and PDS uses path parameter

 

Resource Conformance: MAYServiceRequest

Base System Profile
https://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/ServiceRequest
Profile Conformance
SHALL
Reference Policy

Interaction summary
  • SHOULD support search-type, read.

Documentation

API present in

  • e-Referral Service Patient Care.
  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API
  • e-Referral FHIR API

No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements

Search Parameters
ConformanceParameterTypeDocumentation
MAYidentifiertoken
  • e-Referral FHIR API
MAYpatient:identifiertoken
  • e-Referral Service Patient Care)
  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API
MAYServiceRequest.identifiertoken
  • Booking and Referral - FHIR API believe this should be identifier same as eRS

title: NHS England APIM Base API Definitions
description: High level summary of FHIR api's used within NHS England API programmes

resource.documentation:
API present in 
 - [Booking and Referral - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/booking-and-referral-fhir) 
 - [National Record Locator - FHIR API v3](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/national-record-locator-fhir/v3/producer) as STU3 
 - [e-Referral Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-fhir) 

 No [UK Core FHIR Access](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7-UK/UK-Core-Access/index.html) conformance requirements

searchParam.name: subject:identifier
searchParam.documentation:
- [Booking and Referral - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/booking-and-referral-fhir) 
 - [National Record Locator - FHIR API v3](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/national-record-locator-fhir/v3/producer) 

 International and Care Connect API suggest using patient instead of subject, this would also be consistent with other NHS England API's

searchParam.name: custodian:identifier
searchParam.documentation: - [Booking and Referral - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/booking-and-referral-fhir)

searchParam.name: next-page-token
searchParam.documentation: - [Booking and Referral - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/booking-and-referral-fhir)

searchParam.name: based-on:identifier
searchParam.documentation: - This may not be correct and is inferred from A005 [e-Referral Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-fhir)

resource.documentation:
API present in 
 - [Booking and Referral - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/booking-and-referral-fhir) 

 No [UK Core FHIR Access](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7-UK/UK-Core-Access/index.html) conformance requirements

searchParam.name: Endpoint.identifier
searchParam.documentation: - [Booking and Referral - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/booking-and-referral-fhir) believe this should be `identifier`

resource.documentation:
API present in 
 - [e-Referral Service Patient Care](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-patient-care-fhir)
 - [e-Referral FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-fhir)
  - [Booking and Referral - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/booking-and-referral-fhir) 

 No [UK Core FHIR Access](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7-UK/UK-Core-Access/index.html) conformance requirements

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: e-Referral FHIR API

searchParam.name: HealthcareService.providedBy
searchParam.documentation: - [Booking and Referral - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/booking-and-referral-fhir) believe this should be `organization:identifier`

searchParam.name: HealthcareService.identifier
searchParam.documentation: - [Booking and Referral - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/booking-and-referral-fhir) believe this should be `identifier`

resource.documentation:
API present in 
 - [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-fhir) 
 - [e-Referral Service Patient Care](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-patient-care-fhir)
 - [e-Referral FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-fhir)
  - [Booking and Referral - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/booking-and-referral-fhir) 

 Used by 

 - EPS consumers. 

 No [UK Core FHIR Access](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7-UK/UK-Core-Access/index.html) conformance requirements

searchParam.documentation: e-Referral FHIR API

searchParam.name: Organization.identifier
searchParam.documentation: - [Booking and Referral - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/booking-and-referral-fhir) believe this should be `identifier`

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: - [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-fhir)

searchParam.name: active
searchParam.documentation: - [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-fhir)

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation: - [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-fhir)

searchParam.name: name
searchParam.documentation: - [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-fhir)

searchParam.name: address-country
searchParam.documentation: - [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-fhir)

searchParam.name: ods-role
searchParam.documentation: - [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-fhir) EPS expects this data to be `type`

searchParam.name: ods-lastChangeDate
searchParam.documentation: - [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-fhir) FHIR developers would expect this to be `_lastUpdated`

searchParam.name: ods-activeRole
searchParam.documentation: - [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-fhir) concerned we have two searches on an extension

resource.documentation:
API present in 
 - [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-fhir) 

 No [UK Core FHIR Access](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7-UK/UK-Core-Access/index.html) conformance requirements

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: - [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-fhir)

searchParam.name: active
searchParam.documentation: - [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-fhir)

searchParam.name: primary-organization
searchParam.documentation: - [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-fhir)

searchParam.name: participating-organization
searchParam.documentation: - [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-fhir)

resource.documentation:
API present in: 
 - [Personal Demographics Service FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/personal-demographics-service-fhir) 

 Used by 

 - EPS consumers. 

 SHOULD and SHALL conformance is taken from [UK Core FHIR Access](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7-UK/UK-Core-Access/index.html) - MAY is used to indicate no conformance (added due to rendering issue in the publisher)

searchParam.name: _fuzzy-match
searchParam.documentation: PDS using non standard parameter

searchParam.name: _exact-match
searchParam.documentation: PDS is using non standard parameter. Do not believe this is :exact from [modifiers](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/r4/search.html#modifiers) although it sounds similar and may cause confusion

searchParam.name: _history
searchParam.documentation: PDS is using non standard parameter. Do not believe this is _history from [history](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/r4/http.html#history) this probably results in confusion for developers

searchParam.name: _max-results
searchParam.documentation: PDS is using non standard parameter. PDS probably should be using _count [_count](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/r4/search.html#count) which should be ok as PDS does not support paging

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: A search by NHS Number. Missing from PDS is a read operation instead - so using transient id instead of identifier

searchParam.name: address-postcode
searchParam.documentation: PDS is using non standard parameter - **will be deprecated in the future**

searchParam.name: general-practitioner
searchParam.documentation: A search by ODS Code. PDS SHOULD be using `general-practitioner:identifier` with `token` type to follow NHS Digital FHIR policy. It is workable as it is but this is searching on an `id` which is transient (changeable), searching on `identifier` is recommended.

resource.documentation:
API present in 
 - [e-Referral FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-fhir) 

 No [UK Core FHIR Access](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7-UK/UK-Core-Access/index.html) conformance requirements

searchParam.name: _query
searchParam.documentation: - e-Referral FHIR API

resource.documentation:
API present in 
 - [e-Referral FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-fhir) (NOT CONFORMANT) 

 No [UK Core FHIR Access](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7-UK/UK-Core-Access/index.html) conformance requirements

searchParam.name: practitioner:identifier
searchParam.documentation: [e-Referral FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-fhir) - This parameter is NOT present but is believed to be implied. This API is believed to be NOT CONFORMANT as the api as currently stated should return all PractitionreRole's held by eRS and this is clearly not correct.

resource.documentation:
API present in 
 - [Personal Demographics Service FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/personal-demographics-service-fhir) 
 -  Proxy.  

 No [UK Core FHIR Access](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7-UK/UK-Core-Access/index.html) conformance requirements)

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: A search by NHS Number. Proxy query parameter and not supported on PDS

searchParam.name: patient:identifier
searchParam.documentation: A search by NHS Number. Proxy uses query parameter and PDS uses path parameter

resource.documentation:
API present in

- [e-Referral Service Patient Care](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-patient-care-fhir)) 
 - [Booking and Referral - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/booking-and-referral-fhir)
